intro: Triglochin maritima var. altoandina, commonly known as the Andean marsh grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It typically grows in wetland and coastal environments, characterized by its succulent, grass-like leaves and small, white flowers. The plant has a robust root system that helps it thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. It is often found in regions with high humidity and moderate temperatures. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to its specific ecological niche.
